definitions.definition: To fly high with little effort, like a bird .
To mount upward on wings, or as on wings, especially by gliding while employing rising air currents .
To remain aloft by means of a glider or other unpowered aircraft.
To rise , especially rapidly or unusually high.
examples: The pump prices soared into new heights as the strike continued.

definitions.definition: To rise in thought, spirits, or imagination; to be exalted in mood.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To fly high with little effort, like a bird .
secondary_definitions: To mount upward on wings, or as on wings, especially by gliding while employing rising air currents .
To remain aloft by means of a glider or other unpowered aircraft.
To rise , especially rapidly or unusually high.
( figuratively ) To rise in thought, spirits, or imagination; to be exalted in mood.
